definition: to go everywhere/to scour (the whole town)
(of an animal) to paw (the ground)
to run/to run away/to escape/to run around (on errands etc)/(of a gas or liquid) to leak or evaporate/(verb complement) away/off
everywhere/all over/classifier for actions: one time

sentences.english: With the love of his mother and Jenny, Forrest Gump begins his running all his life.
sentences.chinese: 在他媽媽和珍妮的愛護下，阿甘開始跑遍整個人生。

sentences.english: He traveled the city for a firm which makes furniture.
sentences.chinese: 他跑遍這個城市爲一個傢俱公司作推銷。

sentences.english: The student thumbed his way across the country.
sentences.chinese: 這個學生免費搭車跑遍全國。

sentences.english: We searched the whole town but could not find a barber-shop open.
sentences.chinese: 我們跑遍全城也沒有找到一家開門的理髮店。

sentences.english: I haven’t run much here in London but when I have, it’s beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 我未曾跑遍倫敦各地，但如若成行，想必很是美妙。

sentences.english: The sad and roily mum run to every temple and ask for more juju .
sentences.chinese: 傷心又焦急的媽跑遍了各大廟，求了更多符。

sentences.english: The first time was to search for his son at the countless New York City hospitals.
sentences.chinese: 第一次是跑遍紐約市無數家醫院尋找自己的兒子。

sentences.english: I have walked this district for ten kilometres round.
sentences.chinese: 我已跑遍了這一地區附近10公里內的範圍。

sentences.english: That Santa Claus can cover the entire world in one night distributing presents to everyone!
sentences.chinese: 聖誕老人一晚能跑遍整個世界來給每個小孩分發禮物？

definition: to search everywhere/to search high and low/to comb
to rummage through/to turn everything over/to ransack
to visit (a large number of places)/to tour around (the whole country, the whole city etc)
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about/to hopscotch/also 東跑西顛|东跑西颠[dong1 pao3 xi1 dian1]
variant of 周遊|周游, to tour/to travel around
to cover the whole (area)/to be found throughout
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about
north and south sides of the Yangtze River (idiom)/(fig.) all over China
to visit/to travel to
to toss about in bed/from person to person/indirectly/to wander
great streets and small alleys (idiom); everywhere in the city
everywhere/across the world
to spend all one's money
to travel over land and water (idiom)
to pass over mountains ridges (idiom); fig. hardships of the journey
to seek medical treatment/to see a doctor
